custom_fields.key_topics:
By the completion of this course, students will be able to
1.	Define the role of language in culture.
2.	Define the role of culture in language.
3.	Apply these definitions to media, literary, and cultural sources to express personal ideas on cross-cultural awareness.
4.	Improve speaking ability in MSA on course related topics.
5.	Read in MSA to understand course related topics read in multiple genres.
6.	Write in MSA on course related topics.
7.	Apply critical and analytical thinking to all reading material
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: This is a content course in the Arabic language and not an Arabic language course. Thus, it is expected that your language proficiency in the Arabic language is good.
custom_fields.learning_resources:
This class has no textbook but rather selected readings provided by the instructor. During the week you will read media articles and during weekends, you will read literary and cultural works.

long_desc: This course explores definitions of culture and analyzes the dynamic role of language in culture, and culture in language, with an aim to foster crosscultural awareness and selfrealization while developing proficiency in Arabic. Using an integrated approach to the study of the Arabic language, literature, and culture through close readings of current media sources press, news, magazines, as appropriate, and literary and cultural readings. Additionally, this course is designed to strengthen listening, speaking, reading and writing, within the context of an evolving Arabic culture.
name: Topics in Modern Arabic Language, Literature and Culture
